"Often you'll see slides at conferences that say: 'does my application need blockchain?' The answer is no, We love complexity. We could build blockchain into the network and have fun doing so but zero touch does not need  it. I think it's a distraction."  - Tom Paseka #ITW2019

"You have to stay one step ahead of the technology. The infrastructure is drastically different than 15 years ago. It's about defining a methodology to free up your customers to be successful." - Chris Sharp #ITW2019

Chris Sharp: we saw how automation was implemented with the cloud initially. It was like a science experiment that was set up to fail most times. But now you can easily provision to every major cloud provider from a single portal. We need that for the network side. #ITW2019

"Humans will often deviate from policies. Humans will make mistakes, humans will break policies. So having humans there to initially set it up is fine but then they need to eventually be removed from the process" Tom Paseka, CLOUDFARE #ITW2019 #ZeroTouchNetworks

"I'm a big proponent of automation, but we can't be myopic with how we implement it. It's complicated. Humans over time have been the checks and balances. It's not just about getting it done but getting it done correctly w/o incurring high costs." Jeff Wabik, DC BLOX  #ITW2019
"Self-provisioning services are a prerequisite for things like 5G and AI" - Ravindran Mahalingam, HGC Global Communications #ZeroTouchNetworks #ITW2019
